content.raw: Ah, OK, I was going to say that it'd be much simpler to write a single-shot analysis script which deletes the h5 file, and set it to run last. That way, each shot would go into lyse, have its single-shot routines done (e.g. fit to get atom number), results are saved in the dataframe, then the h5 file is deleted. Multi-shot routines can then continue plotting that atom number as you repeat the experiment. But I guess if you don't have lyse running or it's paused/crashed then this doesn't work (though at least in the case of it being paused it will then still go through and analyse & delete each shot).
content.html: Ah, OK, I was going to say that it'd be much simpler to write a single-shot analysis script which deletes the h5 file, and set it to run last. That way, each shot would go into lyse, have its single-shot routines done (e.g. fit to get atom number), results are saved in the dataframe, then the h5 file is deleted. Multi-shot routines can then continue plotting that atom number as you repeat the experiment. But I guess if you don't have lyse running or it's paused/crashed then this doesn't work (though at least in the case of it being paused it will then still go through and analyse & delete each shot).
